recipe.name: Honey Lemon Chicken
recipe.description: Succulent chicken with a lip smacking honey-lemon sauce. Dinner in a snap - 5 minutes prep, 4 minutes to cook the chicken, 3 minutes for the sauce = 12 minute dinner! Dusting the chicken in flour makes the skin slightly crispy which makes the sauce cling to it. Recipe VIDEO below!

recipeInstructions.text: Slice each chicken breast horizontally to form 4 steaks in total. OPTIONAL (for more even cooking): Pound to even thickness about 1cm/ 2/5" thick.
recipeInstructions.name: Slice each chicken breast horizontally to form 4 steaks in total. OPTIONAL (for more even cooking): Pound to even thickness about 1cm/ 2/5" thick.

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle each side generously with salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Sprinkle each side generously with salt and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Place flour in shallow dish. Coat the chicken in the flour, shaking off excess.
recipeInstructions.name: Place flour in shallow dish. Coat the chicken in the flour, shaking off excess.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix 1 tsp of the flour (reserved from step 3) with the water. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix 1 tsp of the flour (reserved from step 3) with the water. Set aside.

itemListElement.text: Place butter and oil in a skillet over medium high heat until butter is melted and hot. Add chicken and cook for 2 minutes or until golden brown. Turn and cook the other side until golden brown, then transfer onto a plate to rest.
itemListElement.name: Place butter and oil in a skillet over medium high heat until butter is melted and hot. Add chicken and cook for 2 minutes or until golden brown. Turn and cook the other side until golden brown, then transfer onto a plate to rest.

itemListElement.text: Add garlic into the skillet and stir for 20 seconds or until golden. Add chicken broth / stock and bring to simmer. Use a spatula to scrape the brown bits from the bottom of the pan into the liquid.
itemListElement.name: Add garlic into the skillet and stir for 20 seconds or until golden. Add chicken broth / stock and bring to simmer. Use a spatula to scrape the brown bits from the bottom of the pan into the liquid.

itemListElement.text: Add honey, lemon juice, soy sauce and flour/water mixture (from step 4) into the skillet. Mix and bring to simmer for 2 to 3 minutes until thickened into a syrup. Add salt and pepper to taste.
itemListElement.name: Add honey, lemon juice, soy sauce and flour/water mixture (from step 4) into the skillet. Mix and bring to simmer for 2 to 3 minutes until thickened into a syrup. Add salt and pepper to taste.

itemListElement.text: To serve, pour Sauce over the chicken and garnish with parsley and lemon slices if using. Alternatively, return the chicken to the pan for 30 seconds (to reheat), turning to coat in the sauce.
itemListElement.name: To serve, pour Sauce over the chicken and garnish with parsley and lemon slices if using. Alternatively, return the chicken to the pan for 30 seconds (to reheat), turning to coat in the sauce.

review.reviewBody: Hi Nagi, this recipe was fast and delicious!  Thank you so much for such great recipes!
Nagi üòçüòçüòç wow, I love this recipe. Thank you for sharing it. I served it with rice and steamed veg‚Ä¶ it was a hit!! This will become a regular in our house.
Greetings from Iraq, I loved the recipe, Thank you so much. It is very easy to make and the ingredients are so simple.
This is one of my family's go to recipes.  My father is even making it.  Everyone loves it!!  Thank you!
I used about a tablespoon of cornflour instead of the plain flour from the recipe - it worked really well.
This is the BOMB!! So tasty, juicy, and best of all - easy! Thanks Nagi for yet another scrumptious recipe :-)

hi Nagi,
I love reading your recipes and I do cook quite a lot because i like it! keep up your good work and send recipes
Russell.

Family loved it!  No surprise actually, they love all your recipes!  Extremely quick and easy!  Thank you Nagi for all these wonderful recipes!  I don‚Äôt even remember what I did for dinners before I started following you!
Wasted my chicken, tasted like cough syrup on chicken. Whole family was disappointed

This was once again a perfect recipe.  
Going to try it with salmon tomorrow night and thinking it would also work with lime juice.

Love this recipe, easy and a regular  in our house now. 
The only thing, first time I made it, it worked perfectly, subsequently the sauce won‚Äôt thicken at all. 
I am making it the same way. 
I have no idea why?

This is always my go-to! It's a fan favorite when I'm cooking for others. I pair it with mashed sweet potatoes and garlic bread. It cooks up nicely and I always make sure to use the leftovers for my lunches for the week. :)
Well she's dine it again. This was light and delicious. My partner said how does she understand flavours so well it's amazing. I served this with a veggie packed rice.

Whole family enjoyed this, husband, 12 yr old and 4 yr old sons and myself.  Amazing achievement as apart from me, they don't really like chicken. Probably the first time everyone ate ALL their dinner. Served with steamed broccoli and potato.
